issues.name: Breach
issues.description: A dispute where one business claims the other failed to perform a material obligation under a commercial agreement (deliverables, service levels, warranties, exclusivity, etc.), resulting in damages or specific performance demands.

issues.name: Payment
issues.description: A dispute focused on unpaid or disputed amounts under a commercial relationship (invoices, pricing, credits, offsets, chargebacks), often turning on contract terms, performance, and accounting.

issues.name: Termination
issues.description: A dispute over whether a contract was properly terminated (cause, cure, notice, renewal) and what consequences follow (fees owed, transition duties, return of materials, survival clauses).

issues.name: Fraud
issues.description: A dispute alleging one business intentionally misrepresented or concealed key facts to induce a deal or obtain money/advantage (capabilities, pricing, financial condition, compliance, or intent), causing reliance-based harm.

issues.name: Interference
issues.description: A dispute where a business claims another intentionally disrupted an existing contract or a near-certain prospective deal (poaching a customer, pressuring a supplier, spreading false claims to derail performance).

issues.name: Unfair Competition
issues.description: A dispute alleging improper competitive conduct between businesses (misuse of confidential info, false comparative claims, passing off, deceptive tactics aimed at business customers or channel partners).

issues.name: Patent
issues.description: A dispute alleging a business product or process infringes a patent, often involving technical operation, product development history, and damages/royalty theories.

issues.name: Trademark
issues.description: A dispute about confusingly similar branding or use of marks in commerce that harms another business's brand identity, goodwill, or channel relationships.

issues.name: Copyright
issues.description: A dispute alleging unauthorized copying or use of protected works in a commercial context (software, documentation, marketing assets, images, training materials).

issues.name: Trade Secret
issues.description: A dispute alleging misappropriation of protected confidential business information (code, methods, pricing, customer data, product plans) used to compete unfairly.

issues.name: Collusion
issues.description: A dispute alleging competitors coordinated conduct that restrains competition (price-fixing, bid-rigging, market allocation), often tied to pricing, bids, and market behavior.

issues.name: Monopolization
issues.description: A dispute alleging a dominant firm used exclusionary conduct to maintain or gain market power (foreclosure, tying, predatory tactics, restrictive contracting, refusal to deal).

issues.name: Deceptive
issues.description: A dispute alleging misleading commercial representations made by one business to another (performance claims, pricing representations, comparatives, contractual terms, compliance claims) that affected purchasing or partnering decisions.

issues.name: Class/Rep
issues.description: A representative proceeding alleging a standardized business practice caused common harm across many similarly situated business counterparties (e.g., franchisees, distributors, resellers, merchants, or other commercial customers), typically challenging uniform terms, policies, fees, or representations.

issues.name: Coverage
issues.description: A dispute over whether a commercial policy applies to a loss or claim and the scope of defense/indemnity obligations, often involving notice, exclusions, and policy interpretation.

issues.name: Bad Faith
issues.description: A dispute alleging an insurer unreasonably handled or evaluated the claim (delay, inadequate investigation, improper denial, lowball valuation), causing additional harm beyond the coverage dispute itself.

issues.name: Bankruptcy
issues.description: A business insolvency matter involving disputes over claims, contracts, asset disposition, or adversary proceedings arising in the bankruptcy case.

issues.name: Restructuring
issues.description: A dispute tied to renegotiating debt or obligations (workouts, forbearance, recapitalization), often involving lender/creditor negotiations and governance decisions.

issues.name: Creditor Rights
issues.description: A dispute where a creditor seeks to enforce contractual or statutory rights (priority, liens, guaranties, claims objections, collateral disputes) against a business counterparty.

issues.name: Avoidance Actions
issues.description: A bankruptcy-related claim seeking to unwind certain transfers to recover value for the estate (e.g., preference or fraudulent transfer theories).

issues.name: Non-Compete
issues.description: A dispute between businesses (often involving a competitor as a defendant) over whether post-employment restrictions are being violated through competitive work, competitive hiring, or use of a former employee to gain an unfair market advantage.

issues.name: Non-Solicit
issues.description: A dispute between businesses over alleged solicitation of customers, prospects, vendors, or employees, typically involving a competitor accused of leveraging a departing employee or coordinated outreach to move relationships.

issues.name: Confidentiality
issues.description: A dispute alleging a departing employee improperly disclosed or used confidential business information, with the competitor accused of receiving, using, or benefiting from that information.

issues.name: Trade Secrets
issues.description: A dispute alleging misappropriation of trade secrets through employee movement or collaboration between companies, focusing on whether protected information was taken, used, or incorporated into competing offerings.

issues.name: SaaS
issues.description: A dispute about a hosted software service relationship (availability, performance, data access, usage limits, renewals, support commitments) and resulting damages or termination rights.

issues.name: License
issues.description: A dispute about software licensing terms (scope, seats, audit rights, royalties, sublicensing, compliance) and whether use exceeded the grant or triggered payment obligations.

issues.name: Implementation
issues.description: A dispute about delivery of technology services (missed milestones, failed go-live, defects, change orders, acceptance, integration issues) and who bears the cost of remediation.

issues.name: Lease
issues.description: A dispute between businesses over a commercial lease (rent/CAM, maintenance, default, renewal, assignment, buildout obligations) and the consequences of alleged noncompliance.

issues.name: Title/Ownership
issues.description: A dispute over ownership interests or transaction defects in commercial property (encumbrances, closing issues, allocation of risk, indemnities) affecting control or value.

issues.name: Defect
issues.description: A dispute alleging nonconforming or defective construction work on a commercial project, often involving responsibility among GC/subs/design professionals and the cost of repair.

issues.name: Delay
issues.description: A dispute about schedule impacts, acceleration, disruption, or critical-path delays on a project, including entitlement to time extensions or delay damages.

issues.name: Payment
issues.description: A dispute over progress payments, retainage, change order compensation, lien-related issues, or pay-when-paid/pay-if-paid disputes in a commercial project.
